intro: Daucus laserpitioides var. apterus, commonly known as the slender carrot, is a perennial herb native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its roots are typically thin and not as fleshy as those of the common carrot. This variety is often found in moist, calcareous soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal and potential medicinal properties.
